Happy New Year! Wishing all a healthy, happy, and rewarding 2017.

The new Republican agenda will weaken Medicare and undermine its sustainability. Is Medicare important to you, a family member or love one? Share how you and your family have benefited from #Medicare in the comments below, so we can remind the House Majority what is at stake. #shareyourstory

As I've said, when the President-Elect is right, I'll support him. When he's wrong, I'll go to the mat for the American people. When it comes to the independent ethics committee, the President-Elect is right. The 11th hour move to slash transparency and government accountability is shameful. Reforms to how Congress conducts ethics reviews should be bipartisan and discussed in the light of day for the American people to see.

It was an honor to hear from President Obama about the road ahead. I'm ready to fight to make sure Americans don't lose access to the healthcare they need. The ACA provides critical care for those with pre-existing conditions and lets children stay on their parents' plans until they're 26. With coverage at an all time high and costs increasing at the lowest rate in 25 years, we can't afford to pull the rug out from millions of Americans.

The life of Medicare has been extended thanks to the ACA. Republicans rushing to repeal it also risk undermining the coverage our seniors need and depend on. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/01/03/508074966/republicans-take-the-first-step-to-repeal-obamacare
It's always a privilege to see Gabby Giffords. Thanks for taking the time to speak with me about how we can help prevent gun violence and keep our families and communities safe.

The American people have a right to know that their President is making decisions for the good of the country—not the good of their own bank account. That’s why I’m proud to cosponsor the Presidential Tax Transparency Act to require those who hold—or seek—the highest office in the land to disclose their tax returns. The President has tremendous power, and you have a right to know their financial interests aren’t compromising their judgment.
Thanks to IOLERO and the Sonoma Sheriff’s Department for hosting an important meeting on immigration policy in Santa Rosa.

This weekend I inspected the Napa floodgates with Count Supervisor Diane Dillon.  Very pleased to see them keeping our community safe even as the Napa River reached just over 25 feet.

Congratulations to Charles Wyckoff on attaining the rank of Eagle Scout!

The Constitution says our President cannot accept gifts from foreign officials—no matter what. But Mr. Trump’s businesses are raising some serious red flags.

Thank you to the workers and community leaders who spoke out yesterday at the Graton Day Labor Center (Centro Laboral de Graton). We are a nation of immigrants, and I will continue to reject anti-immigrant rhetoric and policies.

Productive meeting with Duane Duaner— head of the California Hospital Association —about what repealing the ACA will mean for the children, seniors, and working families who rely on Medi-Cal. Republicans should #KnowTheRealCost before they rip coverage away from those in need

Today I called on Congress to preserve the healthcare Americans rely on—including Raymond from my district, who was diagnosed with renal cancer and saw his premiums skyrocket until we passed the ACA. We can’t let Republicans return people like Raymond to a time when the care they needed was always beyond their grasp.

Thanks to everyone who joined us in Vallejo to recognize Martin Luther King Day. Dr. King remains an inspiration to all of us, and his legacy reminds us what we can accomplish when we all speak out as one.
Thank you to everyone who helped plant trees in Napa today as part of MLK Day of Action and Compassionate Napa Valley! Proud to see how invested our community is giving back.

Like many of you, I have deep concerns about the comments President-elect Trump has made, the actions he’s taken, and the values he represents. I was conflicted about whether to attend his inauguration, but ultimately I chose to follow the example of President Obama and Secretary Clinton and see through the transition from one administration to another.  Mostly, I want the President-elect to know I will be there from day one. I’m not going to run and hide, and I won’t back down from a fight when it comes to our rights and values as Americans.

Today the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office released a shocking report. If Republicans' ACA repeal plan moves forward:  18 million Americans will be uninsured within 1 year 32 million will be uninsured by 2026 Americans in the individual market will see their premiums double  To make it worse, more than 3 million jobs are on the line too. We can’t afford this reckless repeal. #KnowTheRealCost

Excited to see the Pacific Responder arrive at the Mare Island Dry Dock, LLC. (MIDD)! The Pacific Responder is a dedicated Oil Spill Response Vessel, and has kept our oceans clean since its delivery in 1992. I’m proud that the workers at MIDD will be inspecting and repairing the Pacific Responder so it can keep doing its important work.

Thanks to Rep. Mark DeSaulnier, Rep. Barbara Lee, Congressman Jared Huffman Congressman Eric Swalwell, and everyone who joined us for our Labor Town Hall at the Institute for Research on Labor & Employment, UC Berkeley. I enjoyed hearing your thoughts on the challenges facing our workforce and how we can help working families get a fair shake

My Washington office will be open from 8:30 AM – 4:30 PM on Friday and Saturday this week for constituents visiting from out of town who have questions or need assistance.   On Friday, all pedestrian entrances to House Office Buildings will open at 5:00 AM—except for the Cannon Rotunda Entrance and the Lower Independence Ave Entrance to the Rayburn Building.   On Saturday, visitors must enter through the 24 Hour Entrance on South Capitol in the Longworth Building or the horseshoe entrance at the Rayburn Building.   If you have any questions, please call my office at 202-225-3111.
First meeting of the Gun Violence Prevention Task Force in the new Congress. We’ve already witnessed too many tragedies this year. It’s time for commonsense solutions to keep Americans safe.

Citizenship Legal Services hosted an informative training workshop for volunteers who want to help legal permanent residents become citizens. Keep up the great work!   If you’re interested in learning more, visit https://napacitizens.org
The Republican’s ACA replacement plan would mean your insurance premiums could double over the next decade. This is a bad deal for the American people. #KnowTheRealCost

Thank you, Mayor Osby Davis, for everything you did for Vallejo. Your actions pulled our community out of tough times, and you’ve been an inspiration and mentor to our children. I wish you all the best in your future endeavors!
Thanks to Alexandra McGee from MCA Clean Energy for sharing new green energy options available to the Napa Valley Coalition of Nonprofits. We need to do everything we can to #ActOnClimate.

Congratulations Congressman Xavier Becerra, soon to be sworn in as our state's first Latino Attorney General! It was a pleasure working with you in the House, and I know you'll serve the people of California well!

Today the Senate’s considering Rep. Tom Price to head up the Department of Health and Human Services. For years, Price has spearheaded efforts to gut the Affordable Care Act—an action that could leave 32 million Americans without coverage and 3 million without jobs. Americans deserve a better deal. #PriceIsWrong

This weekend, millions of women worldwide came together to assert their right to make their own choices about their bodies. Rep. Price would rather see women lose access to healthcare. He’s called for defunding Planned Parenthood and restricting a woman’s right to choose. It’s clear #PriceIsWrong for HHS

Thanks, Napa Valley Education Foundation, for all you do to help our students excel! Superintendent Patrick Sweeney gave an inspiring address at this year’s BIG Event, and I’m excited to work alongside the Foundation, our teachers, and our schools to ensure every student is prepared for college, their career, and the world beyond.

Thanks, Alzheimer's Association, for stopping by to discuss the Walk to End Alzheimer’s. I’ll continue to do everything I can to make sure Alzheimer’s research is a priority at the National Institutes of Health (NIH)
Proud to visit Santa Rosa Junior College to see how they’re making education more accessible for our students. Keep up the good work!

Our students have to meet strict standards to get a passing grade. The same should be true for our Secretary of Education. Unfortunately, Betsy DeVos hasn’t mastered the basics yet. Her testimony last week made that clear, and I urge the Senate to listen to the millions of Americans who’ve said our kids deserve better.

Refugees like my former intern Mikey have sacrificed so much for a chance at the American Dream. He put his life on the line for our troops, and I cannot thank him enough for his service. Read his story in his own words:

Immigrants like Mikey make our country stronger. They risk their lives for their families, their freedom, and for us. All because of the promise America offers. Thank you, Mikey, and everyone who has sacrificed so much to be part of our country. We are all better for having you here

Thanks so much to the organizers of the North Bay Community Engagement Fair for providing folks with much needed volunteer and organizing opportunities.  Now more than ever we need to be actively engaged in our local communities and our political system!

Today I spoke against a measure that would undermine our background check system for firearm purchases. I’m a gun owner and strong supporter of the 2nd Amendment, but we must take commonsense steps to keep Americans safe. Watch my full remarks:

Thanks to the volunteers and activists who stopped by my Santa Rosa Office to advocate in support of the ACA. Now more than ever, it’s important to take an active role in our government. My door is always open to those who want to make their voices heard.
Thanks Habitat for Humanity for stopping by my office. Everyone deserves a decent place to live, and I applaud the good work you do to make that dream a reality for countless families in need.

Very proud to recognize Dr. Aaron Thornton as the Napa-Solano Medical Society’s Physician of the Year! Thanks for all you’ve done to address our nation’s opioid epidemic, bring much needed supplies to Haiti, and treat the people of our district day in and day out.

Saddened to hear of the passing of Elizabeth Basile. She dedicated her life to education and activism. She was a true mentor to the kids of Santa Rosa, and I was honored to call her my friend. Thank you, Liz, for all you did for so many.
Very proud to join the Latino Caucus of California Counties at their leadership meeting. Keep up the great work you do to address the challenges facing the Latino community!

Experts say repealing the Affordable Care Act will cause insurance premiums to double over the next ten years. Share your thoughts on repeal and get answers to your questions at my Healthcare Town Hall this Friday in Vallejo.

Had a great time this weekend at the 28th Annual Sonoma County Farm Bureau Crab Feed! Thanks for all you do to support Ag Days in elementary schools, 4-H programs, and youth leadership programs across our county.

Great work by the Mexican Mobile Consulate at Napa Valley College! They offer same-day processing of consular identification, Mexican passports, certified copies of birth certificates, and free legal consolations. Now more than ever, it is great to see such support for our immigrant community
Getting ready to introduce my bill to prevent fires and explosions of fuel containers. Thanks to Margarett Lewis and James Hillman for your tireless advocacy!
Great meeting with the California Farm Bureau Federation about how we can help California farmers and ranchers.

As Chair of the Gun Violence Prevention Task Force, I was very proud to lead a panel at the Democratic Issues Conference on how to help prevent criminals and the dangerously mentally ill from getting guns.
Thanks to the Coalition for Medicare Choices for stopping by my office to share how Medicare Advantage has helped them. I’ll keep fighting to make sure seniors get the care and coverage they deserve!

Congratulations Lesley LemMon, Peter Hockman, and Gary Nelson: this year’s honorees at the Kenwood Education Foundation’s Big Heart Celebration. You’ve each poured your time, energy, and heart into making a difference for our kids. Thanks for everything you’ve done!
I know this is a time of fear and uncertainty for many. If you or someone you love is concerned about ICE, remember that you have rights

Congress must investigate the ties between Russia and the Administration. This goes beyond Michael Flynn. Given the reports we're hearing about Russian military aggression and the FBI's concerns that some officials in the White House may have been at risk for blackmail, it is imperative we act swiftly and decisively to keep Americans safe.

Flame arresters will keep families safe from fires and explosions of fuel containers--a major cause of burn injuries. Thanks to Dr. David Greenhalgh and Dr. Tina Palmeri from UC Davis and Shriners Hospital as well as Margrett Lewis for being such strong voices on this topic. I'm proud to reintroduce my bill to protect consumers.

Great meeting with Dr. Fred Wood, Chancellor of the Contra Costa Community College District, Tim Farley, and other Board Members. Both Dr. Wood and I are products of our community college system. We know firsthand the impact it makes in students’ lives. I’m proud to support summer Pell Grants to help students continue their education, and I’ll keep fighting hard for our community colleges.
Congrats to the winners of the 19th Annual Stars of Lake County Community Awards. Your creativity, compassion, and contributions to our county have made a tremendous impact. Keep up the great work!

Our country works best when we work together, so I’m disappointed that Sen. McConnell won’t bring Democrats to the table to pass tax reforms. This has always been a bipartisan process, and steamrolling Democrats will hurt the millions of Americans we represent.
Congratulations to Bill Pinches on his induction to the California Waterfowl's Hall of Fame! His carved duck decoys are some of the best I’ve ever seen
Hosting my third ACA Town hall at Napa Valley College!

Suggesting Immigration And Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers are members of the police undermines the relationships our local law enforcement agencies have established with immigrant communities. Crimes may go unreported because victims fear they or their loved ones could be deported. So at the urging of our local law enforcement officers, I’m calling on ICE to remove the word “Police” from their gear
Great town hall on the ACA with more than 2,000 constituents! This is the power of democracy. I'll take your stories back to Washington as I keep fighting to #ProtectOurCare
Happy birthday to my partner, wife, and love of my life. Janet, you're the best!
Always happy to talk with concerned constituents. I’ll keep fighting for the rights and values we all share. Thanks for stopping by to share your thoughts!
Great to see the new facilities at the North Bay Regional Center.  Thanks for everything you do to support those with developmental disabilities!

Great panel from Benicia Mayor Elizabeth Patterson, Kaiser COO Deborah Raymond, and Vallejo Together founder Maria Guevara on women in leadership. You’re an inspiration to many in our district!   And if you know of a woman who should be recognized for her leadership, you can nominate her for Woman of the Year here:   https://mikethompson.house.gov/sites/mikethompson.house.gov/files/2017wotynom.pdf.

Americans deserve to know where their President’s interests really lie. That’s why I joined Congressman Bill Pascrell, Jr. and House Democrats in demanding Congress to request the President’s tax returns. #CongressCanRequest
Great to talk tax reform with the Federation of Exchange Accommodators  this morning. I'm proud to fight to preserve like-kind exchanges, which help families and entrepreneurs make new investments.
Press Conference on Republican Proposals to Undermine Public Safety

23 years ago today, Democrats and Republicans came together to pass the Brady Bill—to help keep guns out of the hands of felons, domestic abusers, and other dangerous people. It’s kept us all a lot safer, but there’s still more work to do. That’s why I support background checks on all commercial gun sales. Today of all days, let’s remember that public safety isn’t partisan—it’s American.
In 15 minutes, I'm joining Ways and Means Democrats to talk about healthcare. Watch live at https://www.facebook.com/waysandmeanscommitteedems/
‪This is the exchange between Sen. Franken and Sessions during the confirmation hearing. Seems pretty clear to me. What do you think? ‬

Congratulations to Officer Justin Pell on being named the Exchange Club’s Officer of the Year. Your work on the CHP’s Golden Gate Division Special Response Team has been exemplary, and your volunteer work throughout Sonoma is what community policing is all about. Thank you for your service!

As Founder and Co-Chair of the Invasive Species Caucus, I was glad to visit with environmentalists and activists about the impact these species can have on native wildlife. In California, we have seen this all too well with the Quagga mussel and other harmful invasives. Natural ecosystems should be preserved.
The students at Las Juntas Elementary School are doing some incredible work in their S.T.E.A.M. Lab, learning math and science as well as the arts. I know you’ve all got bright futures ahead!
‪Time to put a stop to Russian scandal. Independent investigation NOW.

Great to sit down with residents of the Vineyard Valley Mobile Home Park and talk about how we can put people back to work and protect our healthcare system. Thanks to my friend, Grace Kistner, for organizing this community meeting!

Thanks to Collabria Care and Director Shelley Dombroski of the North Bay Alzheimer’s Association for hosting a panel discussion this week. It’s vital we make sure families have the resources and information they need when a loved one is diagnosed with Alzheimer’s or dementia. Congress must continue to invest in researching new treatments.
Great to see so many join La Luz Center and the Hanna Boys Center for a “Know Your Rights” panel. There’s been lots of uncertainty about immigration, but we all still have basic rights.

The President’s newest Muslim ban is just as dangerous as the original. Barring refugees and turning our backs on the most vulnerable among us makes it harder to form coalitions to defeat threats like ISIL. Orders like this one are also prime recruitment tools for terrorists. Rather than keeping America safe, this ban puts us all in considerable jeopardy.

The GOP’s working hard to keep Americans in the dark about their ACA repeal. We've had no hearings, they aren't doing a proper fiscal analysis, and they're ignoring the American public who have turned out in droves at local town halls and in Washington to voice their concerns.   We don’t know the full impact, but the estimates we’ve seen are devastating:   30 million Americans will lose their coverage 3 million will lose their jobs   Meanwhile, billionaires and corporations get a tax cut.   This is beyond reckless. Speaker Ryan should not push this through without proper vetting.

Thanks to David Hill of Kaiser Permanente, Marita Dorenbecher of the Yountville Council, Miss Napa County 2016 Giselle Cisneros, Greg McQuaid, and everyone who organized and participated in this Sunday’s Napa Valley Marathon!

Now the GOP is proposing to shorten the lifespan of the Medicare trust fund. Seniors shouldn't have to bear the cost of cutting taxes for billionaires.
#TBT to June 14, 1964: playing catcher for the Carpy gang, tagging out the Lucerne catcher. Can anyone name some of the other people in the photo?
Happy 40th Anniversary to the Arts Guild of Sonoma! Thanks for all you do to support our community’s artists and promote arts education.

Congratulations to Blanca Huijon, Irma Luna, Kevin Massie, Melissa Patrino, Cesar Lopez, and Helen Pelayo on winning the Napa County Hispanic Network's Lifetime Achievement and Friends of the Network awards. You’ve made an incredible impact on our community. Thanks for all you’ve done, and keep up the good work!
Ridiculous for the White House to claim its employees don’t have to follow ethics rules. Public officials should be held to higher standards, not given a free pass.

Thanks to everyone who came out to the Elsie Allen High School Foundation’s 2nd Annual Fiesta! You’re giving our kids a great shot at achieving their dreams, whether that’s going to college or learning the skills they need to join our workforce. And a special thanks to Octavio Diaz and his team from Agave for a fantastic meal!
Thanks to Hercules Rotary President Holly Smyth, Rotarian Steve Kirby, and the entire Hercules Rotary for all you're doing to support and improve our Heritage Garden and community center!
As Ezra Klein writes, the sad reality of the ACA repeal is that the more help you need, the less you'll get.

Congrats to the Hercules Police Department on earning the William H. Spurgeon, III Award from Boy Scouts of America! You’ve mentored countless young men and women through the Law Enforcement Exploring Program, offering them new insights into our criminal justice system through training, practical exercise, competitions, and other activities. Thank you for all you’ve done to give our kids new opportunities, and keep up the good work!
Got my bracket filled out. Who do you have going all the way?

Today the President released his Budget Blueprint. What do you think about his proposals to:  • Use over $4 billion in American taxpayers’ money to fund his border wall • Eliminate $35 million for Section 4 Affordable Housing • Cut $667 million from FEMA pre-disaster mitigation programs • Cut the funding for the DOT, including $500 million in road projects • Cut the budget at the EPA by 31%, eliminating 3,200 jobs • Cut the budget at the State Department by 29% • Eliminate the National Endowment for the Arts and PBS

Senate Intel Leaders—and Republicans—found no evidence to support the President’s wiretap claims. The President should focus on the important task of putting Americans back to work rather than spreading easily disproved conspiracy theories.
Happy St. Patrick’s Day! And congratulations to Benjamin Emmanuel who at 96 received the St. Patrick’s Lifetime Achievement Award for his contributions as an architect and volunteer in Rodeo!
Proud to celebrate 50 years of breaking barriers and blazing new trails with the Napa Junior Girls Softball League!
Important conference hosted by Sonoma County Latinos in the Work Place about how we can move forward together. Thanks to everyone who spoke up!

More than 1.5 million kids would lose access to their after-school programs in the President’s budget. We should be helping kids succeed—not cutting them off from programs that help them do better in school and make them more likely to graduate.

The new Wellness Center at Redwood Middle School will help more kids get access to the care they need. NVUSD Wellness Program does great work helping our students stay healthy and cope with any stress, trauma, or illness they face. Keep up the great work!

Brian and Taylor did a great job representing Sonoma County and Energy Independence at the annual Sonoma County Home & Garden show. Proud to see such a strong interest from the thousands who came out to the County Fairgrounds!

Thank you Women Veterans of Yountville for sharing your thoughts and concerns about how the Affordable Care Act repeal would affect you. I’ll keep fighting for the healthcare you all need and deserve!

Proud to stand with Vice President Joe Biden and Democrats on the 7th anniversary of the ACA. 20 million Americans gained coverage because of this landmark bill. We should be working on strengthening healthcare and making it more affordable—not ripping away coverage from millions of hardworking families and asking them to #PayMoreForLess

Wetlands play a crucial role in preventing floods, mitigating storm surges, and preventing soil erosion. They’re also an important habitat for many species of birds. Glad to have a chance to talk with the Congressional Sportsmen's Foundation this morning about my bill to protect wetlands by reauthorizing the North American Wetlands Conservation Act for another 5 years.

It’s my honor to recognize this year’s Women of the Year in the Fifth Congressional District: Karen Cakebread, Madelene Lyon, Sylvia Villa-Serrano, Ronit Rubinoff, and Dr. Rhonda Renfro. A special recognition was presented to Annie Roberts on behalf of the First Lady of Napa Valley, the late Magrit Mondavi. Thank you all for the incredible contributions you’ve made to our district.

Supervisors Shirlee Zane, Susan Gorin, and Lynda Hopkins did a great job at the National Organization for Women’s forum in Santa Rosa this week. Great way to cap off Women’s History month! Thanks for all your hard work on behalf of Sonoma County!

Best wishes to Leona Egeland Rice on her retirement from the Doctor’s Company! You made history as the 15th woman ever to be elected into the California Assembly. It was a privilege to work with you, and I wish you all the best!
It was an honor to join House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi and veterans service organizations for a roundtable on improving healthcare for our women veterans.
Thanks to Mariposa and Puertas Abiertas for hosting an informative workshop for local parents about college prep and career training opportunities for our kids!
Honored to recognize my friend Sen. Bill Dodd for all the work he’s done with the California Children’s Health Initiative to make sure everyone has access to affordable, quality healthcare.
ICYMI – I’m fighting to help homeowners who want to protect their property from earthquakes. More people should have access to retrofits that keep them safer and prevent costly damage down the line.
Congratulations to the winners of the JD Fullner Recycling Leadership Awards. It’s important we do everything we can to reduce our footprint and protect our environment, now more than ever!

Students at Hercules High School got a glimpse of what their futures could hold at their recent career day. Thanks to everyone who shared their stories and spoke with our kids about the opportunities ahead of them

Great meeting with Dr. Fred Wood, Chancellor of Contra Costa College; Board President Vicki Gordon; and Vice President Tim Farley. Now more than ever, earning a degree is a critical step towards landing a good job. On average, California students with an AA degree earn twice as much as they did before graduation after only two years in the workforce.
Let me see if I follow. If the President doesn’t get his way with Republicans, he’ll work with Democrats to make a “not as good” but also “very good” form of healthcare. Clear as mud.

Thanks to Latino Leader Round Table Napa for hosting Napa County District Attorney Allison Haley, Sheriff John Robertson, and Chief Steve Potter for an important discussion on immigration and other topics of importance to the Latino communities in Napa.

Even in California, women still earn just 86 cents for every dollar men make. And over a year of working full-time, she’ll earn $10,500 less than a man. That’s unacceptable. Equal pay shouldn’t be a dream; it should be reality. We need to strengthen the Equal Pay Act to make sure women are paid fairly for the work they do. #EqualPayDay

Congratulations again to Mia Johansson for winning The Congressional App Challenge in our district. Her app—Times Table Math—helps elementary students learn multiplication. I was beyond impressed by her demonstration, as well as everything she’s been working on since winning the challenge. You’ve got a bright future ahead, Mia!

School nutrition programs help more than 30 million students across the country stay healthy and focused in class. Thanks to Kerri Braverman, Irene Reynolds, and your colleagues from the Vallejo City Unified School District for speaking with me about the impact school nutrition has made on our students.

Excited to see the plans for the future Contra Costa County Admin Building. It’s going to be a great resource for residents, and it will put our district to work as we make these much needed improvements

Sonoma Raceway is an iconic and important part of our district, supporting our economy and attracting thousands of visitors each year. I was glad to sit down with NASCAR Commissioner Mike Helton to talk about how we can make sure tracks all across the country continue creating jobs and helping our communities thrive.

Productive meeting with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs and Oakland Regional Office to talk about how we can improve claims, appeals, and care for veterans in our district and across the country.

Thanks to County Supervisor Susan Gorin for holding an important town hall on Highway 37. It was hit hard by the last bad storms, and rising waters could take an additional toll. We need to discuss our options so we don’t shut down the main thoroughfare between Sonoma and Solano
Proud to celebrate 160 years of the Buena Vista Winery  at this year’s  Signature Sonoma Valley event!

Proud to honor Nancy Cline, Sheana Davis, and Madeleine Keegan O’Connell at YWCA Sonoma County’s 2017 Women, Wine, and Cheese Event. Thank you for all you do to empower women and support our community!
This weekend we recognized the WWI Centennial with the Crockett Memorial Hall Restoration Committee. The sacrifices of those who gave their lives for our country will never be forgotten.
Got questions about what’s happening in Washington? Please join me for a Town Hall Meeting in Sonoma!
Tax season is here, and so are phone scams. Remember: stay alert if someone claiming to be the IRS calls you on the phone. These scams are aggressive and alarming. Learn how you can protect yourself.
Any action on the Korean Peninsula must be in full partnership with our South Korean allies and Congress must be part of the debate and decision process.
Very moving documentary on the USS Indianapolis at the Mare Island Museum. Thank you to Harold Bray and other survivors for sharing your stories.

Rep. John Larson and I just wrapped our Town Hall on Social Security in Napa. Thanks to everyone who shared what Social Security means to them. And if you want to hear about our plan to raise benefits and cut taxes, we’re holding another Town Hall at the Martinez City Hall at 3 PM.

Ripping healthcare away from 24 million Americans is still the GOP’s top priority. We must stay vigilant against any attempt to snatch coverage away from hardworking men and women. Republicans tried to push their repeal through in the dead of night once before. We cannot let them succeed in denying coverage to those with pre-existing conditions or charging seniors an Age Tax.

I always enjoy hearing from constituents about the issues they care most about. Thanks to Susan Gorin, Rachel Hundley, Mayor of Sonoma, La Luz Center, and everyone who joined me at Sonoma Valley High School for a Town Hall Meeting this evening

Happy Earth Day! It’s more important than ever to take a stand for clean water, breathable air, and a stable climate. Our community is fortunate to enjoy some of the cleanest air in the state and the country, but nearly half the country lives in areas with dangerously high air pollution. We must take a stand to support not just the health of our planet, but the health of our kids and families
Thanks to Bernice Espinoza with the Santa Rosa Public Defenders Office for all you’ve been doing to make sure everyone in our community knows our rights.

Great visit to Kaiser Permanente Thrive in Vallejo to talk about the importance of patient-centered care. Kaiser’s commitment to putting people first has helped patients save money. I’m proud to work with them on how we can strengthen Telehealth programs, combat the opioid epidemic, and improve care for everybody.

Just when we thought the GOP’s healthcare repeal couldn’t get worse, their newest amendment could let insurers price gouge sick Americans and states end essential services like prescription drug coverage and hospitalization. It’s so bad, House Republicans exempted themselves from these catastrophic changes. They shouldn’t give themselves a pass while making hardworking families pay more for less

Great meeting with Napa Vintage High alum and noted astronaut Dr. Kate Rubins about her mission on the International Space Station and her important work with NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration. NASA's research with the National Institutes of Health (NIH) will make a real difference in all our lives. That's why it's so important we maintain funding for math and science research and ensure our kids have a solid background in all the STEM fields.
Rep. Thompson on GOP's latest attempt to destroy our healthcare

Thanks to Mayor Jill Techel for holding the first State of the City of Napa - Local Government. Glad to see how much progress we’re making so far this year—especially on the bypass. You’re a great mayor, Jill!

In his first 100 days, the President hasn’t delivered anything but empty promises. He said he’d put the country back to work, but there hasn’t been a jobs bill. He said he’d bring the cost of healthcare down, but instead he pushed a bill that would send premiums skyrocketing if you’re sick or a senior. Thankfully he couldn’t get it off the ground, but he hasn’t given up yet, either. We all have to stay alert throughout the next 100 days and beyond.

An omelet’s a good start to any morning—especially when you can enjoy it at Clear Lake State Park! I was happy to lend a hand cooking breakfast for the annual Wildflower Brunch this morning to support the Park’s Interpretative Education Association’s pavilion and programs.

Congratulations to all the winners of the North Bay Business Journal's 40 Under 40 Event. Our community is home to some truly inspiring business and community leaders. Thank you all for your hard work!

Great meeting with Lake County CAO Carol Huchingson, and congratulations on receiving the Phoenix Award from the U.S. Small Business Administration for all that you’ve done to help our community recover from the Valley and Clayton Fires. It’s richly deserved! You’re doing a great job for our community.

1 in 5 Americans will develop skin cancer in their lifetime, but it’s treatable if it’s detected early. In honor of Skin Cancer Awareness, I spoke with Olympic medalist and melanoma survivor Summer Sanders about the importance of preventing and detecting this disease. Thanks Summer and the American Academy of Dermatology for all you’re doing to raise awareness!

New study shows Covered California enrollees in our district could see their premiums spike by $4,092 per year if the Republican healthcare bill passes. The President might say he wants to bring costs down, but his plan does the opposite.
Had a good discussion with Sec. David Shulkin of the United States Department of Veterans Affairs on how we can improve service and care for our veterans.
Rep. Thompson Speaks Against GOP's Plan to Gut Healthcare

Proud to see the Committee on Ways and Means approve the Medicare Part B Improvement Act with bipartisan support. The bill incorporates two provisions that I’ve fought hard to enact: one to expand Medicare coverage of telehealth services for kidney failure patients, and one to improve patient access to orthotics and prosthetics. By allowing those suffering from kidney failure to use telehealth services, the bill will let chronically ill patients access care at home. And by allowing orthotists and prosthetists notes to be included in a patient’s medical record, the bill helps ensure that individuals who need these devices can access them.

To the critics of my work on gun violence prevention:   First, for those who are saying that any effort to work on gun violence is politics, please know that there is nothing further from the truth. This is POLICY. Every Member of Congress is elected to work and vote on policy, and gun violence is no different.   For those who say this isn’t the time to raise this issues, I ask; when is the time? After the next mass shooting? Or on any one day of the year when 30 people are killed by someone using a gun? That’s the number: 30 people every day killed by someone using a gun.   If you are one who believes there should be no gun laws or one who believes there should be no guns, stop reading now because we will, most likely, never agree.            To clarify specific criticism regarding my work on gun violence prevention:   1. “He’s out to destroy the second amendment.”   I support the Second Amendment and have not proposed nor suggested any bills that are in conflict with the Second Amendment. My legislation would expand background checks to cover all commercial sales of firearms. This is constitutional and supported overwhelmingly by the American people, gun owners included. I’m also co-leading legislation to prohibit “bump stocks,” a device to make semi-automatic guns function similar to fully automatic weapons.   2.  “He owns more guns than the average person, he’s a hypocrite.”   That is half true. I do own guns and given that only a third of Americans own a gun or guns, I do own more than the average person. But, more important, don’t you want someone who knows something about guns working on these issues? As a matter of fact, I often hear or read someone complaining about people passing gun laws who don’t know anything about guns. Or “he or she doesn’t even know the difference between a magazine and a clip.” You can’t have it both ways.    3. “He took a $4k contribution from the NRA.”   True enough. However, the NRA has never endorsed me, annually gives me a D- or F grade, and I haven’t received a contribution from them in well over a decade. And since then, I’ve donated that $4k and more to gun buyback programs in our district.    4. “He wants to take my guns.”   This is only true if you are a criminal, a terrorist, or dangerously mentally ill. I believe in and support the Second Amendment. I also believe and will work tirelessly to keep guns out of the hands of criminals, terrorists, and the dangerously mentally ill.     5. “He’s not working with the Republicans on this issue.”   Not so. I am working with a number of Republicans on my bipartisan bill to expand background checks for anyone buying a gun from a commercial entity. Congressman Peter King, a Republican, is my coauthor. Sadly, the Republican leadership has, for four and a half years, refused to hold hearings or take a vote on this bill. For two years, the Republican leadership has ignored our request to form a Select Committee of Democrats and Republicans to work to find solutions to help prevent gun violence. I’ll work with anyone to keep our community safe.   I became chair of the Gun Violence Prevention Task Force after the tragedy at Sandy Hook Elementary School where 20 first graders were murdered along with six teachers. I’ve worked on this every day since. I’ve worked on this issue the day after the Las Vegas mass shooting and the day before. I’ve talked about it in every town hall meeting and at official and non-official events in our district. Most recently, during a lunch speech at the St Helena Rotary two weeks ago.    Most unfortunately, nearly every day is “the day after a mass shooting.” Las Vegas was the 273 mass shooting in 2017.   So the only ones politicizing this issue are those who sit by and criticize. If you have ideas that will make our communities safe and not conflict with our constitutional rights, let’s hear them. If you just want to criticize or spread misinformation, you are part of the problem.

Today, as Chair of the Gun Violence Prevention Task Force, I led a letter calling on the President to direct the Bureau of Alcohol, Firearms, and Tobacco to prohibit “bump stocks,” the accessory the Las Vegas gunman used to fire so many rounds so quickly into the crowd. These devices only serve to make a gun more deadly and they have no place on our communities.

La calidad del aire puede mejorar o a veces empeorar, rápidamente. • Para disminuir su exposición al humo de los incendios, se recomienda limitar su tiempo afuera y permanecer en el interior tanto como sea posible. • Si es posible, busque albergue en edificios con aire filtrado O muevase a áreas fuera de la región que son menos afectadas por el humo de incendios hasta que los niveles de humo disminuyan. • Mantenga sus ventanas y puertas cerradas a menos que este extremadamente caliente afuera. Si usted no tiene un acondicionador de aire, permanecer dentro con las ventanas cerradas puede ser peligroso en un clima extremadamente caliente. En este caso, busque albergue alternativo. • Use su acondicionador de aire dentro de su hogar o en el coche en reciclar o recircular. Mantenga la válvula del aire fresco cerrada y el filtro limpio para evitar de traer dentro humo adicional. • Los niños, los ancianos y aquellos con afecciones respiratorias como el asma, la Enfermedad Pulmunar Obstructiva Cronica, el enfisema y las enfermedades del corazón son los más afectados. • Si tiene niños, asma u otra enfermedad pulmonar, asegúrese de seguir las instrucciones de su médico acerca de como tomar sus medicamentos y siga su plan de manejo del asma. Llame a su médico si sus síntomas empeoran o cuando y si debe de irse del área. • Pedimos a los residentes que eviten agregar más contaminación al aire limitando las actividades contaminantes del aire, como la quema de leña, el cortar el césped y el soplado de hojas, la conducción y el asar comida. • No confíe en las máscaras contra el polvo para su protección. Las máscaras para la "comodidad" o el "polvo" de papel que se encuentran comúnmente en las ferreterías están diseñadas para atrapar partículas grandes, como serrín. Estas máscaras no protegerán sus pulmones de las pequeñas partículas que se encuentran en el humo de los incendios.

Households impacted by the wildfires in Northern California could be eligible for help buying food through USDA’s Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (D-SNAP), the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food and Nutrition Service (FNS) announced today.  Those who may not normally be eligible for nutrition assistance under regular SNAP rules may qualify for D-SNAP -- if their income is under the disaster limits and they have qualifying disaster-related expenses.  Benefits will be made available to eligible people who either lived or worked in Butte, Lake, Mendocino, Napa, Nevada, Sonoma and Yuba Counties at the time the wildfires began on October 8, 2017; have been affected by the disaster; and meet certain D-SNAP eligibility criteria.  Approved households will receive one month of benefits, equivalent to the maximum amount of benefits normally issued to a SNAP household of their size to meet their food needs as they return to their communities to recover and rebuild.  Current SNAP participants in the affected areas will also receive additional benefits as appropriate to match the D-SNAP amounts.  More Information here:

Important information from FEMA regarding potential fraud:  The Department of Homeland Security’s (DHS) Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) is encouraging disaster survivors from Hurricanes Harvey, Irma Maria, and the California Wildfires to watch for and report any suspicious activity or potential fraud from scam artists, identity thieves and other criminals attempting to defraud the government.  In every disaster, it is important to provide information to the public on how to guard against fraud and report suspicious activity.   FEMA recently became aware of potentially suspicious activity related to the recovery from hurricanes and wildfires including fraudulent registrations.  FEMA and its partners are taking necessary steps to determine impacts of the fraudulent activities and implement long-term solutions.  To address these instances, FEMA is notifying survivors by phone or mail, and we have instituted additional verification and controls in cases where there was suspicious activity, to ensure that only eligible applicants receive assistance. Important information about potential FEMA/SBA fraud:   When a fire survivor registers with FEMA, the applicant’s information is also sent to the Small Business Administration in case that survivor is eligible for business disaster loans. If SBA doesn’t hear from that survivor, they will send them a letter reminding them to apply for disaster loans should they be eligible.   If someone who hasn’t registered for FEMA assistance receives this letter, it is a good indication that the survivor’s information was used illegally in an attempt to receive money to which they are not entitled. If this has happened to you, you should go to a Disaster Recovery Center to report the letter. The folks there will work with you, FEMA, and SBA to find and stop potential impersonators.
